description:
Manual games allow you to set custom check locations and custom item names that will be rolled into a multiworld.
This allows any variety of game -- PC, console, board games, Microsoft Word memes... really anything -- to be part of a multiworld randomizer.
The key component to including these games is some level of manual restriction. Since the items are not actually withheld from the player,
the player must manually refrain from using these gathered items until the tracker shows that they have been acquired or sent.

1.0.4.description:
# Changelog
- Fixed logic for Demo Style characters
- Fixed Dirty Chalk Eraser logic
- Fixed Dangerous Teleporter logic
- Fixed Principal's Whistle logic
- Fixed Beating a Style with All Challenges logic
1.0.4.title: Version 1.0.4

1.1.0.description:
# Changelog
- Fixed Arts and Crafters logic.
- **Fixed logic for many Party and Demo Style checks that were missing their Passes as part of their logic.**
- Fixed the logic for using the Dangerous Teleporter for a check.
- Changed the free checks to be one free check. It's still plando'd because that's the only thing I could do to prevent solo generation failure.
- **Added a Classic Style Pass to compliment the previous major change further, allowing for the potential of any Style being the first one unlocked.**
- **Added an option to pick the Style you want unlocked at the beginning.** (Special thanks to @FuzzyGamesOn in the Manual Discord Server for helping my simple ass learn how to do this)
- **Added Regions.**
- **Added descriptions for goal conditions, including a simplified guide for the NULL goal.**
- Added DeathLink.
1.1.0.title: Version 1.1.0

1.2.0.description:
# Changelog
- **Split the 14 Progressive Math Machines in Demo Style into 7 Progressive Notebooks and 7 Progressive Bonus Math Machines.**
- Added Traps.
- Made the Principal's Whistle item a Filler Item.
  - I mean, let's be honest...it's totally useless in this game, anyway.
- Removed the Free Gift From Baldi Check, as it is no longer needed (see logical change details below).
- **Revamped most of the logic in the game.**
  - Item checks are now for **picking up the item**, not using it.
    - As a result, most items are now marked as Useful, with a couple of exceptions such as the Quarter, Dangerous Teleporter, Dirty Chalk Eraser, and the Poster Portal.
  - Fixed some issues regarding Item logic. For some reason, there was a consistent discrepancy with the Items, allowing for issues that could've appeared in some particular circumstances.
  - **One of the big changes is to how Progressive Notebooks unlocked Checks. Now, you can access the first two Notebooks for free, and you can almost complete a whole run of Classic, Party, or Demo with 2 of their respective Notebooks (and the matching Pass, of course).**
    - Progress will still be halted when you get to the 7th Notebook Check, as you still need the 7 Notebooks and the 4 Exits to progress further.

I think that's all of the changes, unless I'm forgetting something.
1.2.0.title: Version 1.2.0

1.2.1.description:
# Changelog
- Split the usable Items based on what type of Item they are (useful, progression, etc.).
1.2.1.title: Version 1.2.1

1.2.1a.description:
# Changelog
- **Made the Manual compatible with Archipelago 0.6.2.**
1.2.1a.title: Version 1.2.1a

1.2.1b.description:
# Changelog
- This Manual is now compatible with 0.6.3+ of Archipelago.
- Update: Added the Manual's files to GitHub for anyone who wishes to make PR's (Pull Requests) or overall assist with the Manual's development.
1.2.1b.title: Version 1.2.1b
